page.title: 03ROAD COMMUNICATIONS
page.content: The A396 road runs north to south through Bickleigh, parallel with the River Exe. The minor roads are narrow and winding, most with high banks, which tend to make modern car travel - especially for visitors used to fast roads - hazardous and nerve-racking. Minor laybys do little to reduce frustration when a wide or slow moving farm vehicle is encountered. A June survey shows that, apart from the expected heavy traffic flow at the beginning of the morning and at the end of the afternoon, a very steady flow of private cars maintains throughout the main part of the working day. There is a marked increase of private cars during the holiday season of July and August. Most traffic passes through the village.
